text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Bahraini press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- The Manchester College of Arts and Technology is taking over the government-owned Hotel and Catering Training Centre with an initial investment of $2 million.
- The United Nations Development Programme has earmarked $1.5 million to help Bahrainis start their own small businesses.
- Bahrain Islamic Insurance Company issued five million shares worth 500,000 dinars to the public.
- Investcorp Bank posted a 1996 net profit of $90.4 million.
- Bahrain's cabinet agreed on an additional budget to cover wage increases for government employees.
- Bahrain's participation in a joint GCC-European Union meeting in Doha would help improve ties between Bahrain and Qatar, the country's foreign minister said.
